                Like many live-service games, Arc Raiders provides players with a battle pass to complete to obtain a variety of unique cosmetics, currencies, and one-time-use resources that can help with a raid. These are designed to be worked on over time and will take most players a few weeks to wrap up, with some being permanent and others only being available for a limited time.At launch, players can work on the Raider Deck AR/RD 001, which is focused on the Ryder and Voyager outfits. In addition to the outfits, unlockables include outfit variants, hairstyles, face styles, emotes, and more. You can even earn 500 Raider Tokens (premium currency) by completing the entire deck, which can be used to purchase cosmetics from the in-game shop.To unlock these rewards, you'll need to work on feats during your raids, which ask you to perform tasks while journeying throughout the topside. These include tasks like defeating a particular enemy type, dealing damage with certain ammo types, or finding particular loot. Note that feats are specific to decks and are therefore separate from the game's core quests.Completing a feat will reward you with 10 Creds to be used toward unlocking one of the deck items. While you can have three available feats at a time, you'll also get daily bonuses from completing a certain number of decks. These will reset every 24 hours, so you'll want to hop in and knock out at least five feats per day when possible to get the max amount of bonus Creds to use toward finishing the deck.Here's everything you can earn from Raider Deck AR/RD 001.Ryder (Outfit)Voyager (Outfit)Dirt Spray (Face Style)Mayhem PackRecorder x3Noise Maker x5Remote Raider Flare x5Smoke Grenade x3Blue Light Stick x3Green Light Stick x3Red Light Stick x3Scout PackBinoculars x3Tagging Grenade x5Zipline x3Yellow Light Stick x5Fuel Canister (Backpack Attachment)Raider Tokens x50Arc Hunter PackTactical Mk. 2 x1Lure Grenade x3Wolfpack x1Ryder (Outfit Variant)Ryder (Outfit Color)Voyager (Outfit Color)Improvisation PackFlame Spray x3Blaze Grenade Trap x3Gas Grenade Trap x3Herbal Bandage x5Raider Tokens x50Voyager (Outfit Variant)Ryder (Outfit Color)Voyager (Outfit Color)Bandaid Cheek (Face Style)Protection PackLooting Mk. 2 x2Door Blocker x5Noisemaker x5Explosive Mine x3Jolt Mine x5Ninja PackSnap Hook x1Li'l Smoke Grenade x5Scout Ahead (Emote)Raider Tokens x50Hiker (Backpack)Voyager (Outfit Variant)Medic PackTactical Mk. 3 (Healing) x1Defibrillator x3Vita Spray x3Surge Shield Recharger x3Receding (Hair)Voyager (Outfit Color)Raider Tokens x50Squat (Emote)Archeologist Backpack (Backpack)Ryder (Outfit Variant)Raider Tokens x50Mullet (Hair)Ryder (Outfit Color)Gas Canister (Backpack Attachment)Keyholder PackLooting Mk. 3 (Survivor) x2Raider Hatch Key x2Buried City Town Hall Key x1Dam Staff Room Key x1Spaceport Container Storage Key x1Raider Tokens x250

title: Odds Chronicle Rolls Luck And Strategy Into A Tabletop-Inspired Roguelite
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Roguelite is one of the hottest...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Roguelite is one of the hottest subgenres in gaming right now. From Balatro to Drop Duchy, developers have integrated cyclical mechanics into all sorts of other genres. Independent studios eSolu and Team Mojo Games are adding another game to the subgenre with Odds Chronicles.Odds Chronicles combines grid-based combat, a roguelite run structure, and dice mechanics to create its overall package. Each roll of the dice will give your team different resources, including attributes like strength and magic.Dice-based roguelites and roguelikes, including standouts like Dicey Dungeons, have been around for some time, but new takes on rolling the dice are welcome. Bringing dice mechanics into a turn-based grid tactics game is a nice way to build off the SOCOM-like percentages that decide whether or not you'll land your attacks.          We don't have much to go on besides the reveal trailer, but the gameplay and visuals look polished enough to make Odds Chronicles stand out among a sea of other roguelites. The tactical roguelite will launch on Steam and Epic Games Store in 2026, with versions for PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox Series X|S arriving later.

title: Call Of Duty Black Ops 7 PC System Requirements: Here's What You'll Need For November 14
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          In just 10 days, the next...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                In just 10 days, the next installment of Call of Duty will arrive. Activision has already shared the details about when fans can preload Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. Now, the publisher has disclosed what your PC specs need to be in order to play Black Ops 7. That intel was released alongside a new trailer for Black Ops 7 on PC.          Activision notes that Black Ops 7 will only support Intel/AMD processors (with AVX instruction set), and that Intel ARC GPUs require Resizable Bar. The game also needs a broadband internet connection and DirectX12 compatibility. TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot are mandatory as well. Minimum Specifications For Call of Duty: Black Ops 7OS: Windows 10 64 Bit (latest update)CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 1400 or Intel Core i5-6600RAM: 8 GBVideo Card: AMD Radeon RX 470 or NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 / 1060 or Intel Arc A580Video Memory: 3 GBStorage Space: SSD with 116 GB available space at launchRecommended Specifications For Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Recommended specs to run at 60FPS in most situations with all options set to high.OS: Windows 11 64 Bit (latest update)CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 1600X or Intel Core i7-6700KRAM: 12 GBVideo Card: AMD Radeon RX 6600XT or NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 or Intel Arc B580Video Memory: 8 GBStorage Space: SSD with 116 GB available space at launchCompetitive / Ultra 4k Specifications For Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Competitive specs to run at a high FPS for use with a high refresh monitor, and Ultra specs to run the game at a high FPS in 4K resolution.OS: Windows 11 64 Bit (latest update)CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 5600X or Intel Core i7-10700KRAM: 16 GBVideo Card: AMD Radeon RX 9070XT or NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 / 5070Video Memory: 16 GBStorage Space: SSD with 116 GB available space at launchRecommended DriversAMD: 25.9.2NVIDIA: 581.42INTEL: 32.0.101.8132Black Ops 7 will officially launch at midnight local time on November 14 for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One,  Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox on PC. However, players on Battle.net and Steam will be able to start the action on November 13 9 PM PT / November 14 12 AM ET.Outside of the game, the Call of Duty movie is starting to take shape. Yellowstone creator Taylor Sheridan will co-write the script alongside the film's director, Peter Berg. No other specific details about the film are currently known.
